test_framework.objective: Attempt to exploit Skill invocation system
test_framework.methodology: Try invalid inputs, bypass attempts, and injection attacks

critical_finding.description: No dedicated Skill() tool exists in the system
critical_finding.implication: Skills are documentation/procedural guides, not directly invokable functions
critical_finding.security_impact: ROBUST - Attack surface is minimal because there is no Skill() API to exploit

non_existent_skill.reason: No Skill() tool exists to invoke

hook_bypass.reason: Enforcement via documentation not technical barriers

path_traversal.reason: No Skill() tool exists to exploit

prompt_injection.reason: No argument channel to inject into

security_assessment.key_insight: Skill system is inherently robust because Skills are documentation, not APIs

recommendations: Maintain current architecture where Skills are passive documents
Continue to use Hooks for enforcement rather than Skill-level validation
Document the defense-in-depth model for future maintainers
